content:
The virtual TAP workshops, eTAP and V-TAP, cover the same content and provide the same resources as the in-person workshops. They are designed to provide service members with the necessary tools and resources to successfully transition to civilian life. However, there may be some minor differences in the delivery of the material and the format of the resources.

For example, with eTAP, you can access the online course material at any time and can work through the material at your own pace. With V-TAP, however, the content is delivered live, and you will need to attend the scheduled sessions. On the other hand, in-person workshops do offer a number of benefits over the virtual options, including opportunities for one-on-one counseling, networking with other service members and employers face to face, and access to additional resources.

It's also worth noting that some of the content covered in TAP may be adapted to reflect changes in the job market, updates to VA benefits, or changes to the transition process itself. Nevertheless, the overall curriculum is designed to provide information and resources that will be beneficial in the civilian job market. Overall, the virtual TAP workshops do offer similar content and resources as the in-person workshops, so you should be able to get the information you need to make a successful transition to civilian life through either option.
